snippet: In his first public remarks on the political upheaval in Ukraine, President Vladimir V. Putin sought to defend Russia from the fury of global criticism while rallying support at home.
abstract: Russian Pres Vladimir V Putin breaks his studied silence on the political upheaval in Ukraine during a 66-minute news conference seeking to justify Russia's actions and policies; Putin contradicts himself at times and wanders off into obscure historical digressions, while offering a version of the crisis that is fundamentally at odds with the view held by most officials in the United States.
lead_paragraph: In his first public remarks on the political upheaval in Ukraine, President Vladimir V. Putin sought to defend Russia from the fury of global criticism while rallying support at home.

headline.main: Putin, Flashing Disdain, Defends Action in Crimea
headline.print_headline: Putin, Flashing Disdain, Defends Action in Crimea
